net.openhft.collect

Class HashConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.collect.HashConfig

  • public abstract class HashConfig
extends Object
    Immutable hash config.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HashConfig getDefault()
      Returns a config with 0.(3) min load, 0.5 target load, 0.(6) max load, 2.0 grow factor, null shrink condition and 10 default expected size.
      abstract int getDefaultExpectedSize()
      This size is used in no-arg hash container factory methods.
      abstract double getGrowFactor()
      Denotes how much a hash table's capacity is increased on periodical rehashes on adding (putting) new elements (entries).

      Denotes a maximum load a hash table will try to never be denser than specified by.

      Denotes the minimum load a hash table will try to never be sparser than specified by.

      Immediately after hash set or map construction from non-distinct sources (e. g. arrays) it's load could be significantly less than the specified load factor due to expansion.

      Denotes the default desirable hash table load.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefault

        public static HashConfig getDefault()
        Returns a config with 0.(3) min load, 0.5 target load, 0.(6) max load, 2.0 grow factor, null shrink condition and 10 default expected size.

      • getMinLoad

        public abstract double getMinLoad()
        Denotes the minimum load a hash table will try to never be sparser than specified by.
        Returns:
        the minimum load, a value in [0.0, getTargetLoad()]
        See Also:
        withMinLoad(double)

      • withMinLoad

        public final HashConfig withMinLoad(double minLoad)
        Returns a config with the specified min load. Min load allows to limit memory usage of hash tables.

        Updatable linear hash tables can't have min load greater than 0.5.

        Parameters:
        minLoad - a value in [0.0, getTargetLoad()] range
        Returns:
        hash config with the specified min load
        See Also:
        getMinLoad()

      • getTargetLoad

        public abstract double getTargetLoad()
        Denotes the default desirable hash table load. On hash table construction capacity is chosen in order to table's load to be as close to the target load, as possible. HashContainer.shrink() rehashes a table to the target load.
        Returns:
        the target load, a value in [getMinLoad(), getMaxLoad()] range
        See Also:
        withTargetLoad(double)

      • withTargetLoad

        public final HashConfig withTargetLoad(double targetLoad)
        Returns a config with the specified target load. Target load allows to control basic memory usage -- performance tradeoff for hash tables.
        Parameters:
        targetLoad - a value in [getMinLoad(), getMaxLoad()] range
        Returns:
        hash config with the specified target load
        See Also:
        getTargetLoad()

      • getMaxLoad

        public abstract double getMaxLoad()
        Denotes a maximum load a hash table will try to never be denser than specified by.
        Returns:
        the maximum load, a value in [getTargetLoad(), 1.0] range
        See Also:
        withMaxLoad(double)

      • withMaxLoad

        public final HashConfig withMaxLoad(double maxLoad)
        Returns a config with the specified max load. Max load allows to limit minimum performance of hash tables, because too dense hash tables operate slowly.
        Parameters:
        maxLoad - a value in [getTargetLoad(), 1.0] range
        Returns:
        hash config with the specified max load
        See Also:
        getMaxLoad()

      • getGrowFactor

        public abstract double getGrowFactor()
        Denotes how much a hash table's capacity is increased on periodical rehashes on adding (putting) new elements (entries).
        Returns:
        a value in [1.0, getMaxLoad() / getMinLoad()] range
        See Also:
        withGrowFactor(double)

      • withGrowFactor

        public final HashConfig withGrowFactor(double growFactor)
        Returns a config with the specified grow factor. Grow factor allows to control memory usage -- performance tradeoff for steadily growing hash tables.

        Updatable linear hash tables can't have any grow factor other than 2.0.

        Parameters:
        growFactor - a value in [1.0, getMaxLoad() / getMinLoad()] range
        Returns:
        hash config with the specified grow factor
        See Also:
        getGrowFactor()

      • getShrinkCondition

        public abstract Predicate<HashContainer> getShrinkCondition()
        Immediately after hash set or map construction from non-distinct sources (e. g. arrays) it's load could be significantly less than the specified load factor due to expansion. This predicate is used to shrink too sparse hash containers automatically. null condition is considered as constant false predicate: never shrink.

        Particularly useful for construction immutable containers, because they couldn't be shrunk manually after creation.

        Returns:
        shrink condition
        See Also:
        withShrinkCondition(Predicate), HashContainer.shrink()

      • withShrinkCondition

        public final HashConfig withShrinkCondition(Predicate<HashContainer> condition)
        Returns hash config with the specified shrink condition.

        Example: 

         conf.withShrinkCondition(h -> h.currentLoad() + 0.1 < h.hashConfig().getTargetLoad());
        Parameters:
        condition - shrink condition
        Returns:
        hash config with the specified shrink condition
        See Also:
        getShrinkCondition()

      • getDefaultExpectedSize

        public abstract int getDefaultExpectedSize()
        This size is used in no-arg hash container factory methods.
        Returns:
        default expected size
        See Also:
        withDefaultExpectedSize(int)

      • withDefaultExpectedSize

        public final HashConfig withDefaultExpectedSize(int defaultExpectedSize)
        Returns a config with the specified default expected size.
        Parameters:
        defaultExpectedSize - a positive value
        Returns:
        hash config with the specified default expected size
        See Also:
        getDefaultExpectedSize()
